column2: CHAPTER VII
column3: CHAPTER seven

column2: Wherein Freckles Wins Honor and Finds a Footprint on the Trail
column3: Wherein Freckles Wins Honor and Finds a Footprint on the Trail

column2: Round-eyed, Freckles watched the Bird Woman and the Angel drive away. After they were from sight and he was safely hidden among the branches of a small tree, he remembered that he neither had thanked them nor said good-bye.
column3: Round eyed, Freckles watched the Bird Woman and the Angel drive away. After they were from sight and he was safely hidden among the branches of a small tree, he remembered that he neither had thanked them nor said good bye.

column2: Considering what they had been through, they never would come again.
column3: Considering what they had been through, they never would come again.

column2: His heart sank until he had palpitation in his wading-boots.
column3: His heart sank until he had palpitation in his wading boots.

column2: Stretching the length of the limb, he thought deeply, though he was not thinking of Black Jack or Wessner.
column3: Stretching the length of the limb, he thought deeply, though he was not thinking of Black Jack or Wessner.

column2: Would the Bird Woman and the Angel come again?
column3: Would the Bird Woman and the Angel come again?

column2: No other woman whom he ever had known would.
column3: No other woman whom he ever had known would.

column2: But did they resemble any other women he ever had known?
column3: But did they resemble any other women he ever had known?

column2: He thought of the Bird Woman's unruffled face and the Angel's revolver practice, and presently he was not so sure that they would not return.
column3: He thought of the Bird Woman's unruffled face and the Angel's revolver practice, and presently he was not so sure that they would not return.

column2: What were the people in the big world like?
column3: What were the people in the big world like?

column2: His knowledge was so very limited.
column3: His knowledge was so very limited.

column2: There had been people at the Home, who exchanged a stilted, perfunctory kindness for their salaries.
column3: There had been people at the Home, who exchanged a stilted, perfunctory kindness for their salaries.

column2: The visitors who called on receiving days he had divided into three classes: the psalm-singing kind, who came with a tear in the eye and hypocrisy in every feature of their faces; the kind who dressed in silks and jewels, and handed to those poor little mother-hungry souls worn toys that their children no longer cared for, in exactly the same spirit in which they pitched biscuits to the monkeys at the zoo, and for the same reason--to see how they would take them and be amused by what they would do; and the third class, whom he considered real people.
column3: The visitors who called on receiving days he had divided into three classes: the psalm singing kind, who came with a tear in the eye and hypocrisy in every feature of their faces; the kind who dressed in silks and jewels, and handed to those poor little mother hungry souls worn toys that their children no longer cared for, in exactly the same spirit in which they pitched biscuits to the monkeys at the zoo, and for the same reason-to see how they would take them and be amused by what they would do; and the third class, whom he considered real people.

column2: They made him feel they cared that he was there, and that they would have been glad to see him elsewhere.
column3: They made him feel they cared that he was there, and that they would have been glad to see him elsewhere.

column2: Now here was another class, that had all they needed of the world's best and were engaged in doing work that counted.
column3: Now here was another class, that had all they needed of the world's best and were engaged in doing work that counted.

column2: They had things worth while to be proud of; and they had met him as a son and brother.
column3: They had things worth while to be proud of; and they had met him as a son and brother.

column2: With them he could, for the only time in his life, forget the lost hand that every day tortured him with a new pang.
column3: With them he could, for the only time in his life, forget the lost hand that every day tortured him with a new pang.

column2: What kind of people were they and where did they belong among the classes he knew?
column3: What kind of people were they and where did they belong among the classes he knew?

column2: He failed to decide, because he never had known others similar to them; but how he loved them!
column3: He failed to decide, because he never had known others similar to them; but how he loved them!

column2: In the world where he was going soon, were the majority like them, or were they of the hypocrite and bun-throwing classes?
column3: In the world where he was going soon, were the majority like them, or were they of the hypocrite and bun throwing classes?

column2: He had forgotten the excitement of the morning and the passing of time when distant voices aroused him, and he gently lifted his head.
column3: He had forgotten the excitement of the morning and the passing of time when distant voices aroused him, and he gently lifted his head.

column2: Nearer and nearer they came, and as the heavy wagons rumbled down the east trail he could hear them plainly.
column3: Nearer and nearer they came, and as the heavy wagons rumbled down the east trail he could hear them plainly.

column2: The gang were shouting themselves hoarse for the Limberlost guard.
column3: The gang were shouting themselves hoarse for the Limberlost guard.

column2: Freckles did not feel that he deserved it.
column3: Freckles did not feel that he deserved it.

column2: He would have given much to be able to go to the men and explain, but to McLean only could he tell his story.
column3: He would have given much to be able to go to the men and explain, but to McLean only could he tell his story.

column2: At the sight of Freckles the men threw up their hats and cheered.
column3: At the sight of Freckles the men threw up their hats and cheered.

column2: McLean shook hands with him warmly, but big Duncan gathered him into his arms and hugged him as a bear and choked over a few words of praise.
column3: McLean shook hands with him warmly, but big Duncan gathered him into his arms and hugged him as a bear and choked over a few words of praise.

column2: The gang drove in and finished felling the tree.
column3: The gang drove in and finished felling the tree.

column2: McLean was angry beyond measure at this attempt on his property, for in their haste to fell the tree the thieves had cut too high and wasted a foot and a half of valuable timber.
column3: McLean was angry beyond measure at this attempt on his property, for in their haste to fell the tree the thieves had cut too high and wasted a foot and a half of valuable timber.

column2: When the last wagon rolled away, McLean sat on the stump and Freckles told the story he was aching to tell.
column3: When the last wagon rolled away, McLean sat on the stump and Freckles told the story he was aching to tell.

column2: The Boss scarcely could believe his senses.
column3: The Boss scarcely could believe his senses.

column2: Also, he was much disappointed.
column3: Also, he was much disappointed.

column2: I have been almost praying all the way over, Freckles, he said, "that you would have some evidence by which we could arrest those fellows and get them out of our way, but this will never do.
column3: I have been almost praying all the way over, Freckles, he said, "that you would have some evidence by which we could arrest those fellows and get them out of our way, but this will never do.

column2: We can't mix up those women in it.
column3: We can't mix up those women in it.

column2: They have helped you save me the tree and my wager as well. Going across the country as she does, the Bird Woman never could be expected to testify against them."
column3: They have helped you save me the tree and my wager as well. Going across the country as she does, the Bird Woman never could be expected to testify against them."

column2: No, indeed; nor the Angel, either, sir, said Freckles.
column3: No, indeed; nor the Angel, either, sir, said Freckles.

column2: The Angel? queried the astonished McLean.
column3: The Angel? queried the astonished McLean.

column2: The Boss listened in silence while Freckles told of the coming and christening of the Angel.
column3: The Boss listened in silence while Freckles told of the coming and christening of the Angel.

column2: I know her father well, said McLean at last, "and I have often seen her.
column3: I know her father well, said McLean at last, "and I have often seen her.

column2: You are right; she is a beautiful young girl, and she appears to be utterly free from the least particle of false pride or foolishness.
column3: You are right; she is a beautiful young girl, and she appears to be utterly free from the least particle of false pride or foolishness.

column2: I do not understand why her father risks such a jewel in this place."
column3: I do not understand why her father risks such a jewel in this place."

column2: He's daring it because she is a jewel, sir, said Freckles, eagerly. "Why, she's trusting a rattlesnake to rattle before it strikes her, and of course, she thinks she can trust mankind as well.
column3: He's daring it because she is a jewel, sir, said Freckles, eagerly. "Why, she's trusting a rattlesnake to rattle before it strikes her, and of course, she thinks she can trust mankind as well.

column2: The man isn't made who wouldn't lay down the life of him for her.
column3: The man isn't made who wouldn't lay down the life of him for her.

column2: She doesn't need any care.
column3: She doesn't need any care.

column2: Her face and the pretty ways of her are all the protection she would need in a band of howling savages."
column3: Her face and the pretty ways of her are all the protection she would need in a band of howling savages."

column2: Did you say she handled one of the revolvers? asked McLean.
column3: Did you say she handled one of the revolvers? asked McLean.

column2: She scared all the breath out of me body, admitted Freckles.
column3: She scared all the breath out of me body, admitted Freckles.

column2: Seems that her father has taught her to shoot.	Seems that her father has taught her to shoot.
column3: true

column2: The Bird Woman told her distinctly to lie low and blaze away high, just to help scare them.
column3: The Bird Woman told her distinctly to lie low and blaze away high, just to help scare them.

column2: The spunky little thing followed them right out into the west road, spitting lead like hail, and clipping all around the heads and heels of them; and I'm damned, sir, if I believe she'd cared a rap if she'd hit.
column3: The spunky little thing followed them right out into the west road, spitting lead like hail, and clipping all around the heads and heels of them; and I'm damned, sir, if I believe she'd cared a rap if she'd hit.

column2: I never saw much shooting, but if that wasn't the nearest to miss I ever want to see!
column3: I never saw much shooting, but if that wasn't the nearest to miss I ever want to see!

column2: Scared the life near out of me body with the fear that she'd drop one of them.
column3: Scared the life near out of me body with the fear that she'd drop one of them.

column2: As long as I'd no one to help me but a couple of women that didn't dare be mixed up in it, all I could do was to let them get away."
column3: As long as I'd no one to help me but a couple of women that didn't dare be mixed up in it, all I could do was to let them get away."

column2: Now, will they come back? asked McLean.
column3: Now, will they come back? asked McLean.

column2: Of course! said Freckles.
column3: Of course! said Freckles.

column2: They're not going to be taking that.	They're not going to be taking that.
column3: true

column2: You could stake your life on it, they'll be coming back.
column3: You could stake your life on it, they'll be coming back.

column2: At least, Black Jack will.
column3: At least, Black Jack will.

column2: Wessner may not have the pluck, unless he is half drunk.
column3: Wessner may not have the pluck, unless he is half drunk.

column2: Then he'd be a terror.
column3: Then he'd be a terror.

column2: And the next time--" Freckles hesitated.
column3: And the next time-" Freckles hesitated.

column2: What?
column3: What?

column2: It will be a question of who shoots first and straightest.
column3: It will be a question of who shoots first and straightest.

column2: Then the only thing for me to do is to double the guard and bring the gang here the first minute possible.	Then the only thing for me to do is to double the guard and bring the gang here the first minute possible.
column3: true

column2: As soon as I feel that we have the rarest of the stuff out below, we will come.
column3: As soon as I feel that we have the rarest of the stuff out below, we will come.

column2: The fact is, in many cases, until it is felled it's difficult to tell what a tree will prove to be.
column3: The fact is, in many cases, until it is felled it's difficult to tell what a tree will prove to be.

column2: It won't do to leave you here longer alone.
column3: It won't do to leave you here longer alone.

column2: Jack has been shooting twenty years to your one, and it stands to reason that you are no match for him.
column3: Jack has been shooting twenty years to your one, and it stands to reason that you are no match for him.

column2: Who of the gang would you like best to have with you?"
column3: Who of the gang would you like best to have with you?"

column2: No one, sir, said Freckles emphatically.
column3: No one, sir, said Freckles emphatically.

column2: Next time is where I run. I won't try to fight them alone.	Next time is where I run. I won't try to fight them alone.
column3: false

column2: I'll just be getting wind of them, and then make tracks for you.
column3: I'll just be getting wind of them, and then make tracks for you.

column2: I'll need to come like lightning, and Duncan has no extra horse, so I'm thinking you'd best get me one--or perhaps a wheel would be better.
column3: I'll need to come like lightning, and Duncan has no extra horse, so I'm thinking you'd best get me one-or perhaps a wheel would be better.

column2: I used to do extra work for the Home doctor, and he would let me take his bicycle to ride around the place.
column3: I used to do extra work for the Home doctor, and he would let me take his bicycle to ride around the place.

column2: And at times the head nurse would loan me his for an hour.
column3: And at times the head nurse would loan me his for an hour.

column2: A wheel would cost less and be faster than a horse, and would take less care.
column3: A wheel would cost less and be faster than a horse, and would take less care.

column2: I believe, if you are going to town soon, you had best pick up any kind of an old one at some second-hand store, for if I'm ever called to use it in a hurry there won't be the handlebars left after crossing the corduroy."
column3: I believe, if you are going to town soon, you had best pick up any kind of an old one at some second-hand store, for if I'm ever called to use it in a hurry there won't be the handlebars left after crossing the corduroy."

column2: Yes, said McLean; "and if you didn't have a first-class wheel, you never could cross the corduroy on it at all."
column3: Yes, said McLean; "and if you didn't have a first-class wheel, you never could cross the corduroy on it at all."

column2: As they walked to the cabin, McLean insisted on another guard, but Freckles was stubbornly set on fighting his battle alone.
column3: As they walked to the cabin, McLean insisted on another guard, but Freckles was stubbornly set on fighting his battle alone.

column2: He made one mental condition.
column3: He made one mental condition.

column2: If the Bird Woman was going to give up the Little Chicken series, he would yield to the second guard, solely for the sake of her work and the presence of the Angel in the Limberlost.
column3: If the Bird Woman was going to give up the Little Chicken series, he would yield to the second guard, solely for the sake of her work and the presence of the Angel in the Limberlost.

column2: He did not propose to have a second man unless it were absolutely necessary, for he had been alone so long that he loved the solitude, his chickens, and flowers.
column3: He did not propose to have a second man unless it were absolutely necessary, for he had been alone so long that he loved the solitude, his chickens, and flowers.

column2: The thought of having a stranger to all his ways come and meddle with his arrangements, frighten his pets, pull his flowers, and interrupt him when he wanted to study, so annoyed him that he was blinded to his real need for help.
column3: The thought of having a stranger to all his ways come and meddle with his arrangements, frighten his pets, pull his flowers, and interrupt him when he wanted to study, so annoyed him that he was blinded to his real need for help.

column2: With McLean it was a case of letting his sober, better judgment be overridden by the boy he was growing so to love that he could not endure to oppose him, and to have Freckles keep his trust and win alone meant more than any money the Boss might lose.
column3: With McLean it was a case of letting his sober, better judgment be overridden by the boy he was growing so to love that he could not endure to oppose him, and to have Freckles keep his trust and win alone meant more than any money the Boss might lose.

column2: The following morning McLean brought the wheel, and Freckles took it to the trail to test it.
column3: The following morning McLean brought the wheel, and Freckles took it to the trail to test it.

column2: It was new, chainless, with as little as possible to catch in hurried riding, and in every way the best of its kind. Freckles went skimming around the trail on it on a preliminary trip before he locked it in his case and started his minute examination of his line on foot.
column3: It was new, chainless, with as little as possible to catch in hurried riding, and in every way the best of its kind. Freckles went skimming around the trail on it on a preliminary trip before he locked it in his case and started his minute examination of his line on foot.

column2: He glanced around his room as he left it, and then stood staring.
column3: He glanced around his room as he left it, and then stood staring.

column2: On the moss before his prettiest seat lay the Angel's hat.
column3: On the moss before his prettiest seat lay the Angel's hat.

column2: In the excitement of yesterday all of them had forgotten it.
column3: In the excitement of yesterday all of them had forgotten it.

column2: He went and picked it up, oh! so carefully, gazing at it with hungry eyes, but touching it only to carry it to his case, where he hung it on the shining handlebar of the new wheel and locked it among his treasures.
column3: He went and picked it up, oh! so carefully, gazing at it with hungry eyes, but touching it only to carry it to his case, where he hung it on the shining handlebar of the new wheel and locked it among his treasures.

column2: Then he went to the trail, with a new expression on his face and a strange throbbing in his heart.
column3: Then he went to the trail, with a new expression on his face and a strange throbbing in his heart.

column2: He was not in the least afraid of anything that morning.
column3: He was not in the least afraid of anything that morning.

column2: He felt he was the veriest Daniel, but all his lions seemed weak and harmless.
column3: He felt he was the veriest Daniel, but all his lions seemed weak and harmless.

column2: What Black Jack's next move would be he could not imagine, but that there would be a move of some kind was certain.
column3: What Black Jack's next move would be he could not imagine, but that there would be a move of some kind was certain.

column2: The big bully was not a man to give up his purpose, or to have the hat swept from his head with a bullet and bear it meekly.
column3: The big bully was not a man to give up his purpose, or to have the hat swept from his head with a bullet and bear it meekly.

column2: Moreover, Wessner would cling to his revenge with a Dutchman's singleness of mind.
column3: Moreover, Wessner would cling to his revenge with a Dutchman's singleness of mind.

column2: Freckles tried to think connectedly, but there were too many places on the trail where the Angel's footprints were vet visible.
column3: Freckles tried to think connectedly, but there were too many places on the trail where the Angel's footprints were vet visible.

column2: She had stepped in one mucky spot and left a sharp impression.
column3: She had stepped in one mucky spot and left a sharp impression.

column2: The afternoon sun had baked it hard, and the horses' hoofs had not obliterated any part of it, as they had in so many places.
column3: The afternoon sun had baked it hard, and the horses' hoofs had not obliterated any part of it, as they had in so many places.

column2: Freckles stood fascinated, gazing at it.
column3: Freckles stood fascinated, gazing at it.

column2: He measured it lovingly with his eye.
column3: He measured it lovingly with his eye.

column2: He would not have ventured a caress on her hat any more than on her person, but this was different. Surely a footprint on a trail might belong to anyone who found and wanted it.
column3: He would not have ventured a caress on her hat any more than on her person, but this was different. Surely a footprint on a trail might belong to anyone who found and wanted it.

column2: He stooped under the wires and entered the swamp.
column3: He stooped under the wires and entered the swamp.

column2: With a little searching, he found a big piece of thick bark loose on a log and carefully peeling it, carried it out and covered the print so that the first rain would not obliterate it.
column3: With a little searching, he found a big piece of thick bark loose on a log and carefully peeling it, carried it out and covered the print so that the first rain would not obliterate it.

column2: When he reached his room, he tenderly laid the hat upon his bookshelf, and to wear off his awkwardness, mounted his wheel and went spinning on trail again.
column3: When he reached his room, he tenderly laid the hat upon his bookshelf, and to wear off his awkwardness, mounted his wheel and went spinning on trail again.

column2: It was like flying, for the path was worn smooth with his feet and baked hard with the sun almost all the way.
column3: It was like flying, for the path was worn smooth with his feet and baked hard with the sun almost all the way.

column2: When he came to the bark, he veered far to one side and smiled at it in passing.
column3: When he came to the bark, he veered far to one side and smiled at it in passing.

column2: Suddenly he was off the wheel, kneeling beside it.
column3: Suddenly he was off the wheel, kneeling beside it.

column2: He removed his hat, carefully lifted the bark, and gazed lovingly at the imprint.
column3: He removed his hat, carefully lifted the bark, and gazed lovingly at the imprint.

column2: I wonder what she was going to say of me voice, he whispered.
column3: I wonder what she was going to say of me voice, he whispered.

column2: She never got it said, but from the face of her, I believe she was liking it fairly well.	She never got it said, but from the face of her, I believe she was liking it fairly well.
column3: true

column2: Perhaps she was going to say that singing was the big thing I was to be doing.
column3: Perhaps she was going to say that singing was the big thing I was to be doing.

column2: That's what they all thought at the Home.
column3: That's what they all thought at the Home.

column2: Well, if it is, I'll just shut me eyes, think of me little room, the face of her watching, and the heart of her beating, and I'll raise them.
column3: Well, if it is, I'll just shut me eyes, think of me little room, the face of her watching, and the heart of her beating, and I'll raise them.

column2: Damn them, if singing will do it, I'll raise them from the benches!"
column3: Damn them, if singing will do it, I'll raise them from the benches!"

column2: With this dire threat, Freckles knelt, as at a wayside spring, and deliberately laid his lips on the footprint.
column3: With this dire threat, Freckles knelt, as at a wayside spring, and deliberately laid his lips on the footprint.

column2: Then he arose, appearing as if he had been drinking at the fountain of gladness.
column3: Then he arose, appearing as if he had been drinking at the fountain of gladness.

column2: CHAPTER VIII

column2: Wherein Freckles Meets a Man of Affairs and Loses Nothing by the Encounter
column3: Wherein Freckles Meets a Man of Affairs and Loses Nothing by the Encounter

column2: Weel, I be drawed on! exclaimed Mrs. Duncan.
column3: Weel, I be drawed on! exclaimed mrs Duncan.

column2: Freckles stood before her, holding the Angel's hat.
column3: Freckles stood before her, holding the Angel's hat.

column2: I've been thinking this long time that ye or Duncan would see that sunbonnets werena braw enough for a woman of my standing, and ye're a guid laddie to bring me this beautiful hat.
column3: I've been thinking this long time that ye or Duncan would see that sunbonnets werena braw enough for a woman of my standing, and ye're a guid laddie to bring me this beautiful hat.
